summary: This bill, the Iron Pipeline Review Act, directs the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives (ATF) to report on firearms trafficking along the I-95 corridor. The report, submitted annually to the House and Senate Judiciary Committees, will analyze the number of trafficked firearms (including origin, make, and model), the effectiveness of counter-trafficking measures, and the impact of relevant laws. It will also include recommendations for improving enforcement and proposals for legislative and funding actions to combat firearm trafficking.
